summary.para: Retrieves the name of the item as modified to conform to the specified file system.

param.name: fileSystem
param.para: File system to which the name should conform. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

param.name: pVal
param.para: String that contains the name of the item as it conforms to the specified file system. The name in the property is modified if the characters used and its length do not meet the requirements of the specified file system type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.

summary.para: Retrieves the full path of the item as modified to conform to the specified file system.

param.name: fileSystem
param.para: File system to which the path should conform. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

param.name: pVal
param.para: String that contains the full path of the item as it conforms to the specified file system. The path in the property is modified if the characters used and its length do not meet the requirements of the specified file system type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: The value specified for parameter %1!ls! is not valid.

summary.para: Retrieves the date and time that the directory or file item was created and added to the file system image.

param.name: pVal
param.para: Date and time that the directory or file item was created and added to the file system image, according to UTC time.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: The creation date and time are propagated to the attributes that users see when listing the contents of a directory.
IMAPI does not support the extended attribute for CreationTime, and as a result, UDFS populates the CreationTime with the value expressed by the LastAccessed property from the file entry.

summary.para: Retrieves the full path of the file or directory item in the file system image.

param.name: pVal
param.para: String that contains the absolute path of the file or directory item in the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Determines if the item's hidden attribute is set in the file system image.

param.name: pVal
param.para: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the hidden attribute of the item is marked in the file system image; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Retrieves the date and time the directory or file item was last accessed in the file system image.

param.name: pVal
param.para: Date and time that the item directory or file was last accessed in the file system image, according to UTC time.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: UDFS (UDF) uses the LastAccessedTime value for the CreationTime, as IMAPI does not currently support the CreationTime extended attribute.
CDFS (ISO 9660) sets the LastAccessedTime value retrieved by this method to 0, as only the recording time is stored within the File/Directory descriptor.

summary.para: Retrieves the date and time that the directory or file item was last modified in the file system image.

param.name: pVal
param.para: Date and time that the directory or file item was last modified in the file system image, according to UTC time.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation.

remarks.para: When implementing this method, a few things should be taken into consideration:
UDFS (UDF) will use the value provided by as both the CreationTime and LastModifiedTime.
CDFS (ISO 9660) uses the date/time of recording as the CreationTime and LastModifiedTime. As a result, CDFS sets the value of LastModifiedTime to 0.

summary.para: Retrieves the name of the directory or file item in the file system image.

param.name: pVal
param.para: String that contains the name of the file or directory item in the file system image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

remarks.para: To get the full path to the item, call the method.

summary.para: Sets the date and time that the directory or file item was created and added to the file system image.

param.name: newVal
param.para: Date and time that the directory or file item was created and added to the file system image, according to UTC time. Defaults to the time the item was added to the image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.

remarks.para: IMAPI does not support the extended attribute for CreationTime, and as a result, UDFS populates the CreationTime with the value expressed by the LastAccessed property from the file entry.

summary.para: Determines if the item's hidden attribute is set in the file system image.

param.name: newVal
param.para: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to set the hidden attribute of the item in the file system image; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.

summary.para: Sets the date and time that the directory or file item was last accessed in the file system image.

param.name: newVal
param.para: Date and time that the directory or file item was last accessed in the file system image, according to UTC time. Defaults to the time the item was added to the image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.

remarks.para: UDFS (UDF) uses the LastAccessedTime value for the CreationTime, as IMAPI does not currently support the CreationTime extended attribute.
CDFS (ISO 9660) sets the LastAccessedTime value to 0, as only the recording time is stored within the File/Directory descriptor.

summary.para: Sets the date and time that the item was last modified in the file system image.

param.name: newVal
param.para: Date and time that the directory or file item was last modified in the file system image, according to UTC time. Defaults to the time the item was added to the image.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

description.para: FileSystemImage object is in read only mode.

remarks.para: The last modified time is propagated to the attribute that users see when viewing the properties of a directory or a file.
When implementing this method, a few things should be taken into consideration:
UDFS (UDF) will use the value provided by IFsiItem.put_LastModifiedTime as both the CreationTime and LastModifiedTime.
CDFS (ISO 9660) uses the date/time of recording as the CreationTime and LastModifiedTime. As a result, CDFS sets the value of LastModifiedTime to 0.

summary.para: Base interface containing properties common to both file and directory items.
To access the properties of this interface, use the or interface.
